intro: Topobea caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed topobea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
